Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a picture of a habitat on land or in water, such as a playground, garden, forest, pond, or stream.
The student can include different types of plants in the habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, or flowering plants.
The student can include different types of animals in the habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can show how different living things exist in specific places within the habitat.
The student can identify and compare the differences in plant and animal life in two different habitats through their drawings.
The student can observe and represent patterns of where plants and animals live within the habitat.
